SENT.plain: Reports of Bluefarb-Stewart syndrome have been infrequent
Two observations of this condition are described
Both patients are young men who presented with extensive angiomatous lesions of the feet, revealing distal arteriovenous fistulas
Surgical treatment was successful in one patient
As to pathogenesis the most likely hypothesis is that the arteriovenous fistulas are congenital
Bluefarb-Stewart syndrome can therefore be classified as one of the angiodysplasias
